Data Exploration - Multivariate

Within this section I was complete the EDA specifically relating to multivariate analysis. Multivariate analysis is analysis involving two or more variables.

Data Understanding

To see code analysis created for data understanding follow this link here

Data Visualization

Scatter Plot for Inventions and Marine Protected Area

Code 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
merged = pd.read_csv("/Users/kendallgilbert/dsan-5000-project-kendallgilbert180/dsan-website/5000-website/data/01-modified-data/merged.csv")

import seaborn as sns

sns.lmplot(
    data=merged, 
    x="Inventions (number)",
    y="Marine Protected Area (sqkm)"
    )
/Users/kendallgilbert/anaconda3/lib/python3.11/site-packages/seaborn/axisgrid.py:118: UserWarning: The figure layout has changed to tight
  self._figure.tight_layout(*args, **kwargs)

Correlation Analysis

Pearson Correlations

Code 
test = (merged.corr(method='pearson', numeric_only=True))
test

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

corr_matrix = merged[["Instruments (number)", "Inventions (number)"]].corr()

# Create a heatmap
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 6))  # Adjust the figure size as needed
sns.heatmap(corr_matrix, annot=True, cmap='coolwarm', linewidths=0.5)
plt.show()

Descriptive Statistics

Outliers

Methods / Findings

from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
correlation_matrix = merged.corr(method='pearson', numeric_only=True)
scaler = StandardScaler()
scaled_correlation_matrix = scaler.fit_transform(correlation_matrix)
scaled_correlation_df = pd.DataFrame(scaled_correlation_matrix, columns=correlation_matrix.columns, index=correlation_matrix.index)
